title: Has the covid -19 gone down as predicted by Trump? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, and it won’t truly go down, begin to go down (as far as case counts declining significantly and staying down) until there is a vaccine(s) in circulation in this country and it has been in circulation, being administered to the general population, for at least about a few months time or so. Until that time, it will continue to spread like wildfire, regardless of if you make Trump president (again), or Biden. It will make little real difference. It’s just a matter of what leadership style you prefer, what kind of rhetoric, etc, as it’s all happening around you. Neither of them can truly ‘stop’ it, by themselves. About the best and most effectual thing this admin did was putting into place the ‘Operation Warp Speed’ because that is the only way you’re going to really begin to put a bullet into this thing, so to speak. You can wear all the cloth and paper surgical masks you want, at best you might help mitigate some seasonal flu spread with that (which is good…), but Covid19 will still spread like wildfire without a vaccine; as it is doing now once again in western and southern Europe (France, and Italy) ~ where masks are much more highly enforced than here and their leaders all “follow the science”. Because its viral particles, like its relative and predecessor Sars-CoV, can often make it through or around these commonly worn masks; particularly if or when they are expelled ‘with force’; i.e., via coughing, sneezing, and/or prolonged close — the CDC says 10-15 mins or more but it might be even less than that — contact with a contagious person. Therefore the cloth or paper, etc, repeatedly re-used, non-N95 style masks on everyone (with their eyes mostly uncovered), and these restaurant or bar closures or whatever else of that nature, will do little ultimately to truly stem the tide. At best they’re stopgap measures that temporarily flatten ‘curves’, if even; because people mostly continue to do what they will in private or among close friends or family, as people always will do (in a free country at least; maybe not in China). So, short of literally keeping every single civilian person in the entire country locked inside their own homes or dwellings for perhaps a 2–3 month time span, with military force on the streets enforcing this true universal lockdown under extreme penalties (no contact even between close relatives, and so on) — these on-and-off spotty closures of bars, restaurants, other public places, all these masks on everyone (even all of the healthy regular people), are nearly pointless half-measures at best. (And oftentimes they are less than half-measures; as you can see, even doing all that, as in western Europe, it still continues to flare up and spread once again). It doesn’t matter who is President. (Not to mention, as noted above, even people who wear the masks very regularly don’t all have their eyes protected at all times; would you think a doctor at a hospital would walk into a Covid hot room and deal with a patient wearing only one of these commonly seen masks that people are wearing at the store?? If he did, he’d probably have it a few days later himself). It has been scientifically demonstrated that particles 0.04 to 0.2 μm in size can or do penetrate or ‘go around’ the edges of surgical or (not properly fitted or worn, non-N95 respirator style) cloth face masks, particularly if or when the particles are expelled from the contagious person with force. The size of the SARS–CoV particle from the 2003–2004 outbreak, for example, was estimated to be at only around 0.08 to 0.14 μm. This is extremely miniscule (hard for our minds to conceive how tiny, actually), and smaller even than influenza. Interim Recommendations for Facemask and Respirator Use to Reduce Novel Influenza A (H1N1) Virus Transmission (←—Scroll down to where it says “Facemasks”; this was written well before any kind of “anti-mask” talk was samizdat). From that link, “Facemasks help stop droplets from being spread by the person wearing them. They also keep splashes or sprays from reaching the mouth and nose of the person wearing the facemask. They are not designed to protect against breathing in very small particle aerosols that may contain viruses. Facemasks should be used once and then thrown away in the trash.” Masks are actually probably more effective against influenza spread, most likely, than Sars-CoV. It needs a vaccine, either way you look at it. If you’re anti-vax, fine, don’t get a vaccine. But let about 25, 30, hopefully even 40-some % of the country get it at least, and then you will eventually be able to live more normally once again (and without “masking” — even if the mask hardly matters, ultimately, for most people — everywhere you go, and without having to home-school your kids, close your businesses, and so forth). Otherwise, regardless of who you make president and what kind of science he says he follows, without prompt vaccine(s) it will go on like this for years. That’s why, even if you hate vaccinations, the day that one is finally really FDA approved and begins to be administered to the public should be a day of celebration for all. It will mark a turning point, finally.

It will go away.”“It’s going to go away, hopefully at the end of the month.
